ygData.subject: Re: Skill Changes
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree with you, tis but to have fun in life not to be so serious as to quit a game when you notice it racks up a few extra hrs of time, you can t get back or
ygData.messageBody:
I agree with you, tis but to have fun in life not to be so serious as to quit a game when you
notice it racks up a few extra hrs of time, you can't get back or buy back those hrs so there's no
point in quiting.

What are you going to do, spend more time watching T.V, washing the car, etc etc ? even if you
spent 20 hrs a day awake ya never would get back those hrs you lost, and those are not really lost
hrs if you think of it. Think about the ppl you met and the good times you had with some
conversations, think what kind of person it's made you, and showen you ways to handle different
situations in life. Believe it or not, games are not just kill or be killed, their there for the
community of mortal man and woman, to learn and interact, teach each other new things and new
ideas, share some culteral ideals that you might not have.

Think of it this way, in those 400 hrs, you have reach out to more ppl in that time, then you would
in a life time, spending those hrs at something different. Unless of course you were are actor or
rock star.

Lifes fun, enjoy it for what you have of it, after all, you could die tomorrow, and I'd like to
know i had fun in that time with ppl from all over the world, then sitting on my chair or office,
or such talking to one person, or myself.

Thulgar
Grand Master of the Mystical Knights
http://www.efni.com/~thulgar

Lemac Justerian wrote:

> From: "Lemac Justerian" <lemac@...>
>
> > From: "Vegue, Tony 1047" <tonyv@...>
> >
> > Good point -- a typical work year is 2080 hours. I did a /play and I felt
> > like I was hit with a brick. I clocked about 400 hours since the game
> came
> > out, in March. I started the day it came out. Do you know what I could
> do
> > with my life with 400 extra hours?
> >
> > Needless to say, I quit the game this week.
>
> Wow! I guess we could watch the average 23 hours of TV per week like the
> rest of the country does... Hmmm... wait... that's MORE!!
>
> Or, we could work an extra 20 hours a week??
>
> I don;t know about the rest of you, but I work to live, I do NOT live to
> work! I live to have FUN because that is what *I* believe life is all
> about... Having a GOOD time, a GOOD life, and trying to help others do the
> same thing! But again, that is MY thoughts and opinions, but it's also my
> life...
>
> Sorry to hear you are quiting Tony!
>
> Lemac
